alert.note: Alert for Magoffin; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 10:42PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Breathitt, west central Magoffin and southeastern Wolfe Counties through 1115 PM EST... At 1042 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Athol, or 8 miles east of Beattyville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Oakdale, Widecreek, Guerrant and Mary around 1045 PM EST. War Creek, Lawson, Gentry, Yeadon, Chenowee, Pence, Bethany, Lane and Hollonville around 1050 PM EST. Frozen Creek, Fivemile, Elkatawa, Vancleve, Wilhurst and Curt around 1055 PM EST. Jackson, Simpson, Keck, Sewell, Noctor, Inverness, Dumont, Quicksand and Paxton around 1100 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Taulbee, Rock Lick, Haginsville, Moct, Portsmouth, Smith Branch, Wilstacy, Shockey, Press, Rosefork, Bays, Rousseau, Stevenson, Mountain Valley, Sikes, Burkhart, Belknap, Guage, Cornelia, Camp Lewis, Eugene, Foraker, Puncheon, Lunah, Seiltz, Dale and Lambric. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 65 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
